title: Some links in Configuration Manager do not maintain HTTPS
description:
When SSL (https) is enabled for Manage app server (port 8002), some of the links do not maintain HTTPS protocol and lead to error/blank pages.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable SSL for Manage app server (:8002)
2. Navigate to https://localhost:8002/nav/?type=databases
Configuration Manager should display a list of resources with Edit and Management API icons beside each one.
3. Click on Management API icon for one of the resources

Expected Result:
Since Management API is also on port 8002, the links should lead to HTTPS pages accordingly.

Actual Result:
The links point to HTTP pages which results in error or blank page depending on the browser.

Example of proper behavior can be observed by clicking on one of the resources as mentioned in the steps above. This would lead to a details page for a specific resource. This page contains its own Management API link which correctly points to HTTPS page.

support.workaround: configure their 8000 and 8002 servers to either both be secure or both as not secure.  If you do need then mismatched, then the work-around when the page doesn't resolve is to change the URL to secure/unsecure per your configuration.
